intro: Erythrostemon epifanioi, commonly known as the Epifanio's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers, which are typically clustered in racemes. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
